intro: Casearia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Casearia parvifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
